newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Malaysia Repco in talks on timber unit.
newsitem.headline: Malaysia Repco in talks on timber unit.

text.p: Repco Holdings Bhd said on Thursday that it is in the final stage of talks "for an agreement" relating to its timber division.
The timber and gaming firm did not provide details on the nature of the talks and officials could not be reached for comment.
Repco made the statement to the Kuala Lumpur Stock Exchange following a request to suspend its stock on December 5. Its shares closed at 79.50 ringgit on December 5.
In its 1996 annual report, Repco said that it was confident that prospects in the timber business "are good".

"The group's goal is to move towards value-added downstream activities with the proposals to acquire Kiat Leong Corp Sdn Bhd (in timber moulding) and the Yap Yee Sine Holdings Sdn Bhd timber complex group," the annual report said.
Repco said in the annual report that it also intended to embark on the marketing of floor boards made by Kiat Leong for residential and commercial use.
